title: (x) Laura Ashley "Here to inspire you" script - Lady Dawn {Rainer}
content:
Can anybody shed any light on this, it's used in the UK in Laura Ashley Catalogues and on there website, I suppose it could be handrawn? Feel free to suggest alternatives. Thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [LA Script.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022094616/http:/typophile.com/files/LA%20Script.jpg) | 63.43 KB |
author: lumo

comments.content:
[Liana](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022094616/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/liana/) or Lainie Day and Alejandro Paul has it as [Mr. Lackbows](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022094616/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000079). Don't know what is the hen or the egg. See for example [this discussion](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022094616/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=43341) at WTF.

EDIT: As I see now, there ARE differences between Liana and Mr. Lackboughs. Sorry for that.  
EDIT2: Ah, Mike Y has also [valuable background information](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022094616/http:/typophile.com/node/9942) on this font. So roostertypes has it as [Lady Dawn](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022094616/http:/www.roostertypes.com/view_fullfont.asp?catalogid=19848&issingle=yes).
Thanks Renko, I'll look into these, Lady Dawn seems closest.
